1110676451626348544.text: This is absolutely what events were designed for. We shouldn't be storing anything more in the state than we have to, particularly not for the convenience of offchain consumers, who can build whatever indexes they want. @graphprotocol are helping with making that indexing easier.

1108879015086034951.text:

On Scalability and transactions per second. 
Today I worked on caching and traffic routing based on jsonrpc req type for xDai/POA RPCs.
Got stats for the last 2 hours:
eth_sendRawTransaction - 23 requests vs eth_call - 1,229,654 requests
Writes are overestimated for adoption

1124363761526222854.text: 4/ Investors are often inquiring whether decentralizing the data query layer would make sense. I think that decentralizing this layer is an essential prequisite for decentralizing any layer above, i.e. dApps. This promotes an open and accurate data-marketplace for dApp adoption.

1) Costs of running your own node 
2) Indexer requirements
3) Customers hate downtime - you need to have high uptime even for small Dapp - even if funds are save, the lack of notifications or status about transaction can scare them

1082391160671227904.text:
Alex Skidanov from Near Protocol will be speaking at Graph Day about the frontier of sharding research. Near is an elite team and Alex is working at the forefront of scaling.

Make sure to get your ticket today!
https://thegraph.com/graphday

1081256861154738176.text:
Robert Leshner, CEO of Compound Finance, is going to speak at Graph Day about open financial primitives! Compound's money market is one of those primitives that just makes sense and is brilliantly executed.

Learn from the best. Get your ticket today!
https://thegraph.com/graphday

1080940407469498368.text:
We're happy to share that Josh Nussbaum of Compound VC is speaking at Graph Day on investing in Web3. @josh_nussbaum is one of the most thoughtful and technical investors that we've met.

Make sure to get your ticket today!
https://thegraph.com/graphday

1078723308676276224.text:
Want to work with a passionate team focused on pushing decentralization forward? Are you a Linux, networking, scaling, reliability, automation expert? The Graph is hiring a Devops Engineer!

https://thegraph.com/careers?job=1

1077607035309457409.text: Happy holidays! Remember to take some time for yourself, family, and friends. Happy people make better products and technology

1076144506360086529.text:
Eric Tang, CTO of Livepeer will be speaking at Graph Day! @LivepeerOrg is one of the few decentralized networks with nontrivial mechanisms to successfully ship. @ericxtang will be sharing about their protocol design and roadmap.

Get your ticket today!
https://thegraph.com/graphday

1075784332575264768.text:
We’re excited to announce that Lane Rettig will be speaking at Graph Day about the state of dApps! @lrettig is a core developer on eWasm and has a great lens into the cool things people are hacking on. 

Get your ticket today!
https://thegraph.com/graphday

1075495313517862912.text:
Today we're announcing Graph Day at the historic Grand Theater in SF on January 25th! 

Calling all dreamers  Join the leading protocol and dApp developers working to build a vibrant future with Web3. 

See you at Graph Day! 
 

https://thegraph.com/graphday

1072181850905460738.text: We're thrilled to announce the addition of Jackson Blazensky to our research team working alongside @RezBrandon on our decentralized network design. A recent UCSB grad, he's skilled at cryptography and is incredibly driven. We're excited to watch him make his mark!pic.twitter.com/EnjwhNfGZ5

1070091473377357824.text:
Check out our November Development Update 

We've been hard at work on the Hosted Service while continuing to add new features and bug fixes for existing developers. Come see what's new!https://medium.com/graphprotocol/the-graph-development-update-67ec232fbc81 …

1069622626631524354.text:
Our cofounder and Research Lead @RezBrandon presented "Designing a Decentralized Query Layer for Web3" in Prague following #Devcon4. This is the first presentation outlining our decentralized network design and future research  Watch it here! 
http://ow.ly/Cv6m50jPPrU pic.twitter.com/Zil8RGExzS

1059866058482319360.text:
Another installment of our Development Update is out!

1057212067722211328.text: This Saturday in Prague, @RezBrandon is going to share The Graph's decentralized network design along talks from @dfinity, @nucypher, Avalanche and others. Space is filling up!https://www.meetup.com/The-Innovation-Department/events/255417177 …

1055427408705343489.text: Web3 Summit was a blast. Tonight @RezBrandon is giving a talk on designing a decentralized query layer at Unicorn in Berlin https://www.meetup.com/The-Innovation-Department/events/255417144 …pic.twitter.com/BJEKFMzSVG

1047975348208422912.text:
Hacking at @ETHSanFrancisco? If you use The Graph to query data from smart contracts using GraphQL, you can win $3,500 (1st place) or $1,500 (2nd place) in ETH!

For more info seehttps://github.com/graphprotocol/graph-node/issues/449 …

1047858351621595137.text: Related: Our Graph Node repo just crossed 1,000 commits and we're not slowing down! pic.twitter.com/Gln70HMCwO

1047591017338159105.text:
We just published our latest development update 

Check out what the team has been up to as we head into ETHSanFrancisco https://medium.com/graphprotocol/the-graph-development-update-dbede6136dab …

1042526057851609088.text: You only have FOUR days left to apply as a hacker to @ETHSanFrancisco. We'll be there, everybody will be there, you should be there too! See you there https://ethsanfrancisco.com

1042106944524124161.text: Congrats @MakerDAO on releasing formal verification proofs for multi-collateral Dai using K Framework and KEVMhttps://medium.com/makerdao/the-code-is-ready-2aee2aa62e73 …

1040337193024143361.text: Related: We've had multiple people complain that they've had to disable GitHub notifications for our repo because we've been merging too many PR's

1040272166242148355.text: We just published our first Development Update! Catch up on what our dev team has been up to and read about our latest features https://medium.com/graphprotocol/the-graph-development-update-d90321e22748 …

1039159746081763330.text: We'll be at @ETHSanFrancisco and hackathons across the globe. Come find us and let's #buidl

1038894586805071872.text: Artonomous took 1st place  and won $3,000 for their self-sustaining, self-improving, autonomous artist. Awesome job @isiain @tarrenceva and team! Code herehttps://github.com/artonomous/ethberlin …

1038892026371170304.text: Meetup dApp took 2nd place and won $1,500 for building a subgraph indexing meetup groups and events. Shout out to @Wip_ID @sabinebertram_ and team. Code herehttps://github.com/JohannesHa/meet-up …

1038890601511636998.text: Thank you so much to all the teams who built on The Graph at @ETHBerlin! It was a blast of a weekend and so awesome working with all of you

1038090114373705728.text: We funded a bounty for $4,500 to build a dApp on The Graph at @ETHBerlin. https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethberlin-hackathon/ETHBerlin-Bounties/10/1145 …. Thanks @GetGitcoin. We'll be back!

1037989803873251328.text: The team getting ready for that hackathon @ETHBerlin.pic.twitter.com/JSEY2TuQvB

1037093516382355456.text: @ETHBerlin hackers, we are very excited to announce two bounties for the Hackathon — build a dApp on The Graph or create a Subgraph: https://github.com/ethberlin-hackathon/ETHBerlin-Bounties/issues/10 … https://github.com/ethberlin-hackathon/ETHBerlin-Bounties/issues/11 … The prizes will be distributed via @GetGitcoin and our team is happy to answer all your Qs!

1037092198032896000.text: The Graph is coming to @ETHBerlin! Looking forward to a fun weekend of hacking, meeting with friends and absorbing the incredible momentum of the #Ethereum community. A significant part of our team will be there - come find us at our booth!

1029513719674331136.text: What a lovely write up. Thanks @katerinastro for illustrating the value of indexing blockchain data in a way anyone can understand https://twitter.com/katerinastro/status/1029483211032748032 …

1024456771115438080.text:
So excited to announce The Graph is now open source 

We'll be continuing development of our query protocol for blockchains in public alongside our growing developer community. See you on GitHub and in the Discord!https://medium.com/graphprotocol/the-graph-is-now-open-source-bab53cda6de3 …

1019271043251204097.text:
We got included in this week's Token Economy 
https://tokeneconomy.co/issue-57-fae8990cb343 …pic.twitter.com/3kb7kD6OUL

1017855957898964992.text:
Congrats to the Augur team for shipping this week 

To remain decentralized users have to download a desktop app and sync for 20min

Someone created an untrusted centralized API to make it faster https://augur.casino 

When The Graph launches we could offer a 3rd option

1016852048531185664.text: "To the best of my knowledge, The Graph is the only team building a decentralized query layer for Ethereum. Previously, every single team building dapps on Ethereum had to build a proprietary indexing infrastructure."https://multicoin.capital/2018/07/10/the-web3-stack …

1016402156809641984.text: We just published the first chapter of our story  Please share and give it a read https://medium.com/graphprotocol/introducing-the-graph-4a281b28203e …

1006371384811876354.text: John Resig, creator of jQuery, released a book on GraphQL today. "GraphQL is the best way to fetch data for your app" he says. We agree!https://blog.graphql.guide/introducing-the-graphql-guide-11a5ae48628a …

1004765909452447746.text: We're so thrilled by the overwhelming positive response to our announcement. Thank you for subscribing to our channels. Expect more details in the coming weeks

1004111942900826113.text: We’re so excited to be announcing The Graph!  A decentralized query protocol for blockchains. The Graph lets you build dApps more easily on Ethereum and IPFS using GraphQL. Together we can build a new generation of the web free from monopolies. https://thegraph.com
